Description: Rim and floor fragment of East Greek pottery plate; interior, white slipped; hook meander band on top of lip; broad band with added red band lined in white at outside of floor; frieze of dots between lines around central floral star. Exterior, reserved with banding (Register).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 221, no. 79)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 112. pl. XXXV, no. 323.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1120)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5986 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
